t: Amazon Elastic Container Service - Overview of Deployment Options on AWS

t: Amazon ECS services - Amazon Elastic Container Service
s: You can use an Amazon ECS service to run and maintain a specified number of instances of a task definition simultaneously in an Amazon ECS cluster. If one of your tasks fails or stops, the Amazon ECS service scheduler launches another instance of your task definition to replace it.

t: Amazon ECS vs Amazon EKS: making sense of AWS container services | Amazon Web Services
s: March 31, 2021 - One of the most common requests we hear from customers is, “help me decide which container service to use.” We recommend that most teams begin by selecting a container solution with the attributes most aligned to their application requirements or operational preferences.

t: Introducing Amazon ECS Anywhere | Amazon Web Services
s: January 3, 2023 - In 2014, AWS introduced Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) as a simplified way for customers to address the complexity of managing containers on their EC2 instances at any scale. As adoption increased, customers responded with a new challenge: remove the undifferentiated heavy lifting ...
